page.title: 03RECREATION IN SADDLEWORTH
page.content: The Pennine Way footpath crosses our north-eastern corner over the boggy moorland. The landscape is bleak, and the ground underfoot is wet, with several fords over Broadhead Moss.It is a much-used path by hikers. Other footpaths go up the hillside from both Greenfield & Uppermill to Dick Hill & 'Pots & Pans', a group of stones said to have been a Druidic altar, on the southern boundary of this area. It is visited by walkers, often with their dogs, & is a local landmark. After the 1st. World War, a memorial was erected to commemorate the local men who died. A Service is held there on Remembrance Sundays. Much of Ravenstone Estate is not for public access, but notable features can be seen from the A635 road, such as Adam's Cross, typical scree slopes of Millstone Grit, & the reservoirs.
